title: [INTRO] Mark “RiotScruffy” Yetter - Lead Game Designer, Champions
body:
**WHO AM I?**

Hey everyone,

I’m Mark, but you can call me RiotScruffy here. I’m a totally obsessed video gamer (in the best possible way), and games like DOTA, WoW, LoL, and pretty much anything with the Star Wars brand have occupied the best years of my life. 

I’ve been a few places around the game industry before Riot, most notably I worked at Treyarch on Black Ops 2 right before I joined. They taught me some great stuff about how to make everything feel OP, and how to really sell a fantasy. 

I currently own: 1 cats.

**WHAT AM I DOING AT RIOT?**
There’s kinda two sections here for me, the past and the future:

The past (and present): I’m the Lead Designer of the Champion Update team, which has worked on many of your favorites (and unfavorites I’m sure) like Sion, Poppy, Gangplank, Fiora, Juggernauts, Marksmen updates and many more. I have a TON of history with this team, having helped build it up from the ground when I started at Riot almost 3 years ago until now. 

The future: I’m going to be moving over to be Lead Designer of the Champion team. A new set of challenges and a really talented new group of people there is really exciting. Building up the next generation of new champions and hopefully surprising you all with some great new innovations is my goal. 

**WHAT AM I GOING TO TALK ABOUT?**
Champ-Up has grown and changed so so much over these past years, and I can talk about so many things. “Why did we start doing group updates like Juggernaut/Marksmen?” “How do we decide how much to preserve or redo on a champ-up like Poppy?” 

Or even less specific stuff that is more related to our champion/game design philosophy like: “How have we evolved our strategy for making interactive gameplay without overusing skillshots?” “How do we build up a new champion from concept to completion?” “How did we go about categorizing our champions into archetypes so that we could better understand them (see juggernauts)?”

I’d also like to bridge the gap - when I can - of how our general game design practice can carry over into good character mechanic design and vice versa. It might be cool to do some topics that explore how to apply our champ design principle to other systems or even games altogether. 

**WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO HEAR FROM ME?**
Anything about Champ design or Champion updates is definitely on the table for me. Get creative, I’m open to whatever cool topics you all would like to talk about.

Hey Scruffy, congrats on the new role in the company.

Quick question in regards to your new position, is there any fantasy or gameplay niche you feel is missing from League? Anything that you're looking forward to tackling?

I think there are a bunch of new fantasies that I'd be excited to explore. I'm especially interested in pushing for really really innovative ideas that will completely break the mold of what we currently consider champs can be.

My pet project - The "branching future character:" A good warrior comes in contact with a corrupted weapon, his/her choices throughout the game will either keep them pure or cause the corruption to take over. By the end of the game you have transformed into one of multiple possible kits.

LOL, sounds about right.  It was actually for soraka originally because I think that would be the only way to get her right.  Basically before her rework she had 3 valid playstyle options: lane bully (Q for pushing manaless E for poke), exhaustion based (not the spell) DPS tank, and healer with red and blue healing.  The idea was to either let her cycle between 3 modes or to let her spells morph over time as she bought stats or certain items... sightstone makes her more of a healer, seraph's staff makes her more of a bully.  That sort of thing.

It'd be a cool idea in terms of game theory because building a lot of X would reduce the growth of her in another direction.  So building zhonya's and rylai's would make her more tanky and bully, but they'd also cancel each other out a little bit (tank and AP) as well as hurt her heal.

Then I had an idea to turn Xerath into a capacitor based champ (I play eve online).  At full mana, he's more of a burst mage with good range.  His skills are on a longer cool down and cost more mana but they do more damage.  As he depletes his mana reserves his spells get quicker and cost less mana, but they start doing less damage as well (both in AP and base ratios) and they lose range.  I also had the idea that he should have almost no base health but a shield that recharges quicker as it gets hit until it's below about 30% strength and a mana bar that works similarly... look up capacitors and how they charge energy and you'll understand.

What about a corrupted support (could be a Darkin) that is so obsessed with grief and the feeling of it that he/she hurts her allies in order to save them?

As a player, I'd be scared of griefably and trollability of such a champ.  Now someone who could put up a field that reduced his teams armor and mr by 20% but raised their AD and AP while in it by 20% might be an interesting ult.  Someone who hurt allies for 10% of their current health in order to get a 4 second boost of like 100 armor and MR?  Dunno.  Thematically a shield you form around an ally out of their own blood sounds like something a lot of people would think is cool, but as a terrible ADC who mainly plays support/jungle, the mechanics of that sounds scary.  Maybe an enchantment that boosts the next source of damage from another champ they take and then it gives your ally Armor/MR based on the boosted portion of it.  There's probably ways to do it, but I think it needs to be something that isn't abusable.

Or are you talking about a GA/zylean's ult type effect?  I take 25% of your current health and if you die, you come back with double of what I took or something like that.  That...  that might be something I could see as an interesting support mechanic.

**How come {{champion:62}}  isn't in the #5 Camp, I think he fits with that as much as those 4 do personally.**

I like all 4 of the #5 Champs so here is my stance on what their fantasies are. **I would love to hear if you agree or disagree!**

Also if you look at my account, I primarily play champions in the #5 Camp, Light Fighters, and I think they need some heavy work to not just be stat-checky. I like that they all can turn the fight around in their favor but most of them do it thru just bursting people instantly rather than by tactical play. **Most of these characters are great at waiting for the right moment to strike and they all need more nuance to do it better.** 

___________________________________________________

{{champion:62}} **Deceptive Re-directive Fighter **
 
- I love playing as Wukong because he outright fucks with people
- I wish more focus was on his Clones and decoys rather than just "EQR now I win"
- W with lower CD and E creating Decoy and even Decoy on his R would be hilariously fun for a Monkey Warrior to do
- He should mess with the opponent far more than he just bursts them down
- AS on his E doesn't really make sense and his passive is HEAVY invisible power that is crazy good but not ever noticed
- Suffocated by Mana

{{champion:5}} **Commanding Soldier**

 - Counter engage and constantly able to have an answer in a crazy war environment makes him awesome thematically
 - Would make more sense to have quick AoE offensive bonuses like Battle Cries since he seems like a Commander

{{champion:266}} **Inspiring War-Artist**

- Creates war and strife because he sees it as an art, turns a losing battle into a winning one because its beautiful and poetic
- Being able to show up to a fight and turn the result of it would be perfect for him
- I like his R and think the idea of a Range increase helps with that, and AS + Utility + Sustain is a good mix
- Currently has way too much burst and not enough utility and teamfighting to turn any fight around
- either cheese you immediately or he sucks which doesn't fit his archetype or lore at all

{{champion:39}} **Ebb and Flow Spiritual Master**

 - Way too much straight up burst to match the Flow, not enough Ebb and Flow
 - I like how she can constantly flow in and out of fights either with Q or just fast MS
 - Her E is good in terms of being able to get them off of her to reposition but it having burst is odd
 - She feels like she should be the fighter version of Ahri thematically but her R is just straight up poke burst

{{champion:80}} **Tactical Soldier**

 - I love that his ultimate allows you to show up to save a teammate and fuck over the bad guys and by design it is very tactical
 - I think he should have a lot more tactical uses to his Q and E rather than pure burst
 - His passive and W feel very Strategic battle wise and should be focused even more on that

I agree that wukong also needs a similar approach to those other 3. 

Also, it's correct to call out that these characters need nuance instead of a full redo. Improving on roughly 2 of their abilities would likely get the job done rather than nuking their whole kit. I also agree with a lot of the points you have above and our approach would be about building up on the cool/unique things about those champs.

I have an interesting thought for Irelia. Maybe her ultimate could be a form of a self-buff, such as removing her Q's cool down and increasing her W's damage/healing for a period of time. Also, perhaps reducing the AP scaling of her E or reducing its base damage might mitigate her burst factor. It kind of matches the idea of her being a fighter version of Ahri, flowing throughout the fight.

My first thought is on-hit sheen-proccing assassin-tank.

I'm not sure ebb and flow is quite right ({{champion:267}} is mad now).  It kind of fits ionia though.  Fighter ahri is kinda right but it's kind of wrong too.  She's definitely got an assassin's mobility like Ahri, leblanc, Kass, or Akali but she's also tankier than them.  

Here are some thoughts:

1.  TF is core on her and needs to remain that way.
2.  I also like Bork on her too, that needs to say.  I also like hydra items on her, but those are a rare luxury when feed.
3.  I think she should kinda be like evelynn where she could build a lot of damage or a lot of tank depending on the game.  Think of it more as ebb and flow in terms of item builds.
4.  I wish she could jungle, but she's too money-dependent.
5.  As much as riot hates her, I kind of like her as is.  She's someone I wish you all would leave alone.
6.  If you do anything with the ult, than her W is going to need to be buffed, esp the self heal.
7.  Right now she's kind of simple to learn kit-wise.  I think that needs to stay.
8.  I don't think her Q or W should change.
9.  E generates most of the arguments on her but it's also an iconic part of her kit and enables her outplay potential.  If this is replaced, she needs something that is reliable when she's behind  and can help her turn the lane around to make up for this.
10.  I'd really hate for her to lose that passive.  

While you don't like her ult, it's really important to her kit, especially her sheen proc playstyle.  Without it, she's not that fighter version of ahri you are talking about so much.  She'd lose a lot of healing and damage potential.  Let me put it like this, she can build tank partly because her ult and TF let's her deal damage.  That's a lot of her assassin potential.  Take that away and suddenly she's forced to be squisher or she isn't doing any damage and the nerf/change to E is also taking away her CC.  What's that leave us with?  A broken (bad) Irelia if she goes tank.  However without building tank, I'm not sure she can do some of her diving and outplays that she can do now.  That means she either needs to stay a sustained assassin/tank or the end result of whatever rework probably won't be irelia.  

Then you'd be left with another rework where a lot of the fans of the champ you reworked hate it.  You really don't want to go there.  Cass still sucks cause riot done screwed up her identity.  I hate the new soraka; you guys screwed her rework up as far as I'm concerned and it's obvious half of the problems you guys are having with her is because of how you screwed her up.  Some of the old Karma fans are still bitter.  Riot has admitted the new ashe unfortunately still has the same core problem as the old ashe this preason thanks to all the changes.

I really don't want to see irelia screwed up (she's my only top champ).  Yes there have been good changes, but the track record isn't perfect.

Here's a weird question.  Do you think she could be one of those champs who are both melee and ranged like jayce, nidalee, or elise?  Considering her Ult is ranged, it'd be interesting if y'all turned that into "I'm now a ranged champ" ult and have her flinging swords at people.  If you do that, her old ult could be the ranged form of her new W.  Maybe give her a boomerang style skill in her Q where her blades go out and come back and a ranged CC in her E.

1) We want to solidify his role as a tanky protector type support with armor affinity. The gameplay is pretty nearly 100% and we are working hard on the new visuals. There are some really great surprises in his new kit/visuals but I will not spoil those. 

2) The team is only really able to work on 1 "Big" project at a time like poppy or taric. To fill the spaces in between we use our extra resources to do other projects that have good value for less cost. 

3) No comment on Ao Shin sorry, this was just a way premature reveal and there are a lot things in the pipe on the new champion team right now. 

4) A lot of the work I've started on the Update team will be finishing in 2016, so I will still have a loose hand in it, but my main focus will be running and creating awesome improvements and innovations for our new champion team.

Hey there Scruffy.
As Ghostcrawler already mentioned in his very own Intro you guys consider Darius and Garen to be the two successful Juggernaut updates with Mordekaiser and Skarner being in a somewhat bad spot.

Mordekaiser especially is currently in a very bad spot.
His win ratio hovers slightly above 40%, his pick rate is even worse than pre rework and even though you wanted him to go bot over 60% of Mordekaiser players want and DO play him in a solo lane.
Now, I love the idea of being able to roll all three lanes with my Main but being "forced" bot did suck and most Mordekaiser fans share that notion.

But enough of the grim shadows of the past; The future is where it's at, especially on how you intend to further support the Heavy Metal Juggernaut in the next few months.
He does need your help, even though he'd never admit it.

Most of the frustration behind the rework comes from his Solo lane being really unfun to play out and his Prowess top and mid being nearly nonexistent.
Two things seem to be the cause of this;
-Abysmally low base stats, especially for a Juggernaut
-His W having such a (excuse me) HORRIBLE restriction on it that only serves to inhibit him from using all his skills solo

So, care to share some of your thoughts on this matter, I'd love to hear a bit on your part, seeing that we Morde mains tend to form *ahem* a bit of a circle jerk when left with no Red input whatsoever.

~M.M

I think the original thinking was that morde was oriented towards a solo lane so clearly before, that it would take a lot to make him even remotely viable in the duo lane. In retrospect we clearly overestimated how much we would have needed to do there.

Hey Scruffy.

I want to ask you about Cassiopeia. I assume that you guys are happy with where she is in the meta right now, me too, I also think she's fairly strong but not out of position.

  But I think you missed her weakness on the Howling Abyss; You see, her passive still runs on the same pace as SR, and for a game mode that lasts mostly 20 to 30 mins, a Cassiopeia player won't last to experience the AP transition when reaching 500 stacks (hardly 300 either), and I think it isn't fair for a champion that shines through her passive to not be able to reach that late game fantasy. Even Karthus can get to his late game fantasy faster than Cassio because he's more of an item reliant champion which isn't a problem on the HA, and both Cassio and Karthus usually follow the same build paths. So Cassio is a little left out.

I would love to hear from you Scruff. Love you Rito.

I'd be curious to see this answered too.

Couple of questions: 

1) Do you see a point in time where "ball of stat" characters aren't a thing in league of legends anymore and where everything has counterplay, or do you think the "i have more stats than you so I win" champions are necessary for the game? 

2) What's your stance on instant spells like Annie's tibbers, instant teleports and dashes, etc etc where there's no startup animation and essentially the only way to avoid them is to stay out of that character's zone? 

3) When designing, do you guys set out with a class that you want to make and build around that (IE Juggernaut, Marksman), or do you come up with designs and then build the kit around it that way?

1) I do see a time where that is the case (though itll take a lot of work) and I think it'll be a healthy and fun game to play. There is such a thing as too far though for counterplay, most champs need a mix of reliable and unreliable tools IMO. 

2) In a vacuum I don't actually have too much of a problem with them. The more power that is pushed into a super reliable instant spell means that the other parts of the kit will need to have pretty clear and accessible counters though. 

3) When a designer is starting on a champ they usually have a ballpark of what class it will be, you gotta be aiming for something. Sometimes throughout the early prototypes it will change because theres a really compelling new direction that has risen out of the stuff we didn't anticipate on paper.

I want to comment on ball of stats characters. From my experience in game I've found that ball of stats characters feel necessary, mainly to deal with champions that dramatically reduce the agency of enemies. Champions with good counterplay can deal with balls pretty well, but have strong issues with agency reducing champions. Yasuo is the premier example of this for me, or Kalista. While balls of stats aren't interactive at all, right now I kinda think they're necessary or important to deal with agency reducers.

Granted, my view of which champions are balls of stats may be a bit broader than yours, I see morde mundo and vlad as balls of stats as well as the stuff like irelia and shyvana

Hello! I have a few questions, so sorry if this is a little lengthy!

1. I'm curious about the champion "archetypes" that you mentioned before. We have the six standard classes (Fighter, Mage, Tank, Assassin, Marksman, Support), but we also have the Juggernauts who are...sort of a sub-class, I suppose. A class within a class. What are some other archetypes in the game and how did you group them up like that? 

2. Since you're working with the champ design team, I'm really interested in all the potential new ideas that could come to the Rift.
